text: i'm the chief global water officer
at charity water we're a non-profit
based in new york city and our mission
is to
provide clean and safe drinking water to
people in developing countries
we've reached over 11 million people
in the last 13 years and provided clean
and safe drinking water to
over 50 000 communities in 28 countries
when a well breaks down it's in a very
remote area
and you know the government has very
little capacity to go out there and
check on it the local community doesn't
reach out for help necessarily because
they're
they're so remote so nobody knows about
it and it just goes unfixed
we've developed a remote sensor that
retrofits onto hand pumps in remote
locations in africa and asia
it's got a 10 year battery life and it
has a pre-existing roaming agreement
with every telecom company
in the world basically so that it can be
installed and immediately starts taking
hourly readings of liters
of water flowing through the hand pump
once the data gets
into the aws platform
there it's analyzed and we're looking
for
disruptions in service using cloud
computing and remote sensors and iot
we can get hourly readings for a
fraction of the cost so an exponential
growth
in the amount of data we're able to
connect and an exponential reduction
in the cost of acquiring that data when
it came time to
build this new generation of sensors
twist think has taken on
the mechanical engineering the
electrical engineering
developing the algorithm and then
helping us
build the cloud computing system that is
receiving all of the data from the field
managing it analyzing it and feeding it
back
out in in in reports to the users in the
field
they've really created a great sense of
ownership among their team for this
project
and really gone the extra mile to help
us build the absolute best product
that we possibly can do we're so excited
about
you know the technological developments
in iot in cloud computing
and some of the tools that were we have
access to
through the aws platform and and putting
those to work
for people living on less than a dollar
a day it has
real life-changing potential for them
